item.title: Configuration
item.description: There are several configurations that can be applied to override default behaviours and values of the command-line interface. In the event of a conflict then the environment variable configuration ovverrides the Global Config. Global Config Environment variables Global Config A global configuration file is used to configure the cli at operating system level. TOML [nitroci] # Path where plugins are stored pluginsHome = "$HOME/.

item.title: Workspace File
item.description: Workspace is configured by the means of a workspace.yml file. This file does support go templates hence it is possible to create parameterized files using data objects. There are serveral types of data objects: Workspace data objects: Variables which are defined on the workspace Runtime data objects: Variables that are initialized by the command-line runtime Runtime data objects Workspace sample file Runtime data objects A workspaces can be hierarchically composed with its parent workspaces files.
